# Source Template for Backlog Processing

> Use this template when creating source files for the `chef backlog process` command.
> The pipeline extracts PBIs based on structured content with clear requirements.

---

# [Topic/Feature Area]

## Context

Brief background explaining why this work is needed. Include:
- Current state / problem statement
- Business or technical motivation
- Any relevant constraints

## Items

### [Clear, Actionable Title]

**Type:** feature | bug | tech-debt | spike

As a [role], I want [capability] so that [benefit].

**Current Behavior:** (for bugs/improvements)
Describe what currently happens.

**Desired Behavior:**
Describe what should happen instead.

**Requirements:**
- Specific requirement 1
- Specific requirement 2
- Specific requirement 3

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Testable criterion 1
- [ ] Testable criterion 2
- [ ] Testable criterion 3

**Technical Notes:** (optional)
- Implementation suggestions
- Constraints or considerations
- Relevant code locations

**Dependencies:** (optional)
- Depends on: [other item or external factor]
- Blocked by: [blocker]

---

### [Next Item Title]

**Type:** feature | bug | tech-debt | spike

...

---

## Out of Scope

Items explicitly not included in this work:
- Item 1
- Item 2

## Open Questions

Questions that need answers before work can begin:
- Question 1?
- Question 2?

---

## Tips for High Confidence Scores

| Element | Improves |
|---------|----------|
| User story format | Clarity |
| Specific requirements | Completeness |
| Acceptance criteria | Testability |
| Technical details | Actionability |
| Clear dependencies | Risk analysis |

## What to Avoid

- Vague language: "something", "somehow", "maybe"
- Missing acceptance criteria
- Open-ended scope
- Unresolved questions in requirements
